accomodation.about: A suburb in the lower north shore of Sydney. As there are several buildings heritage-listed it makes it a beautiful place to wander about, providing you a “historic” vibe.  Local spots are the Greenwood Plaza, the Greenwood Hotel and Milson’s Point where you can walk across the Harbour Bridge into central Sydney.
accomodation.directions: If your focus is solely being close in proximity to the wedding location, this is the best option. It’s north of the harbour reducing your travel time immensely but still accessible to Sydney central.

accomodation.about: A neighbourhood made up of historic laneways in the shadow of Sydney Harbour Bridge. The area has some of Sydney’s oldest pubs and restaurants with harbour views as  it was the first place of English settlement in Australia. Local spots are Museum of Contemporary Art, The Rocks Markets, The Glenmore pub, The Australian pub, history tours and selection of other activities. This area will be the most expensive option for accommodation.
accomodation.directions: This is the best option if you want to be midway between the wedding location and central city. It is the first neighbourhood over the harbour

hotels.name: Sydney Harbour Bed & Breakfast
hotels.address: 140-142 Cumberland Street, The Rocks (8 min walk to Circular Quay)

hotels.name: The Mercantile Hotel
hotels.address: 25 George Street, The Rocks (8 min walk to Circular Quay)

hotels.name: Rendezvous Hotel Sydney The Rocks
hotels.address: 75 Harrington Street, The Rocks (6 min walk to Circular Quay)

accomodation.about: Neighbourhood located at the southern end of the central business district. Home of the largest railway station in New South Wales. It’s also known for converted warehouses and a creative scene. Local spots include galleries around Abercrombie Street, Seymour Centre, plenty of places to eat and drink and easy access to all neighbouring suburbs.
accomodation.directions: If your focused on staying pretty central in the city this is your best option.

hotels.name: 28 Hotel
hotels.address: 28 Regent Street, Sydney CBD (8 min walk to Central Station)

hotels.name: Napoleon on Kent
hotels.address: 219 Kent Street, Sydney CBD (3 min walk to Wynyard Station)

hotels.name: Central Station Hotel
hotels.address: 75 Wentworth Avenue, Sydney CBD (5 min walk to Museum Station)

accomodation.about: An area you may associate the word “hipster” with, well known for its trendy inhabitants. Crown and Cleveland streets sport awesome coffee joints, fashion boutiques and eateries from all over the world. Local spots include any pub, any café, any wine bar and any gallery.
accomodation.directions: Again, if you’re focused on staying pretty central Sydney this is your best (and nicest) option.

hotels.name: 57 Hotel
hotels.address: 57 Foveaux Street, Surry Hills (5 min walk to Central Station)

hotels.name: Hotel Harry
hotels.address: 40-44 Wentworth Avenue, Surry Hills (4 min walk to Museum Station)

hotels.name: Rydges Sydney Central
hotels.address: 28 Albion Street, Surry Hills (5 min walk to Central Station)

accomodation.about: The most famous beach of the Northern Beaches. The beach was named by Captain Arthur Phillip. The Corso, a pedestrian plaza consists of shops, coffee joints, cafes and bars. Great coastal spot for shopping and dining. Local spots also include visiting the neighbouring beaches Fairy Bower and Shelley Beach. Good location if you want to avoid the hustle and bustle of Sydney central.
accomodation.directions: Quite easy to get to the wedding location as it’s on the same side of the harbour. Best option to go via a car.

hotels.name: Manly Paradise Motel & Apartments
hotels.address: 54 North Steyne, Manly (7 min walk to Manly Wharf)

hotels.name: The Sebel Manly Beach
hotels.address: 8-13 South Steyne, Manly (8 min walk to Manly Wharf)

hotels.name: Rydges Sydney Central
hotels.address: 28 Albion Street, Surry Hills (5 min walk to Central Station)
